A wallbox is considered 'charging' if it: A wallbox is considered 'charging' if its measured power is >= this threshold.
Base load / house consumption (W) - Stat: Base load / house consumption (W) - State ID (optional)
Battery discharge power (W), positive. U: Battery discharge power (W), positive. Used only for availableForControlledW calculation.
Defines the total charging budget used f: Defines the total charging budget used for priority distribution.
Enables additional debug/info logs and o: Enables additional debug/info logs and optional diagnostics states.
If a module error occurs, diagnostics ar: If a module error occurs, diagnostics are logged/written immediately (ignores intervals).
If enabled, diagnostics data is written: If enabled, diagnostics data is written to adapter states (diagnostics.*).
If set, the adapter also calculates the: If set, the adapter also calculates the target power for controlled loads: availableForControlledW = effectiveLimit - (baseLoad - PV - Battery).
If total budget mode is 'fromDatapoint',: If total budget mode is 'fromDatapoint', this state provides the budget in W.
Keep a wallbox in 'charging' state for t: Keep a wallbox in 'charging' state for this duration after power drops below threshold (prevents flapping).
Keep the charging session timestamp for: Keep the charging session timestamp for this duration after a charging session stops. If it resumes within this window, it keeps its original arrival order.
Log level used for diagnostics output (a: Log level used for diagnostics output (adapter log).
Maximum length for JSON written to diagn: Maximum length for JSON written to diagnostics states (prevents oversized states).
Minimum seconds between diagnostics log: Minimum seconds between diagnostics log lines (0 = every tick).
Minimum seconds between writing diagnost: Minimum seconds between writing diagnostics states (0 = every tick).
Minimum target power for 3-phase AC wall: Minimum target power for 3-phase AC wallboxes. Typical: 4200 W.
Name: Name
Optional external limit (e.g. grid signa: Optional external limit (e.g. grid signal). In dynamic mode the effective limit is min(Max power, Allowed max power) minus Reserve.
PV generation power (W), positive. Used: PV generation power (W), positive. Used only for availableForControlledW calculation.
Pause charging management when Peak Shav: Pause charging management when Peak Shaving is active
Reserve that is subtracted from the effe: Reserve that is subtracted from the effective limit in dynamic mode (e.g. keep headroom).
Used to estimate required reduction from: Used to estimate required reduction from phase over-current.
When 'enforce', phase current limits can: When 'enforce', phase current limits can activate peak shaving even without a power limit.
auto: AC uses setCurrentA if present els: auto: AC uses setCurrentA if present else setPowerW; DC uses setPowerW.
ioBroker state ID (optional). Leave empt: ioBroker state ID (optional). Leave empty if you map via global datapoints.
If meter values are older than this, Pea: If meter values are older than this, Peak Shaving enters failsafe (STALE_METER) and will not release.
Subtracts from the max power limit to ke: Subtracts from the max power limit to keep headroom for meter delay and load spikes.
If enabled, Peak Shaving can activate im: If enabled, Peak Shaving can activate immediately on spikes, bypassing activate delay.
Select spike detector: max of recent win: Select spike detector: max of recent window or current raw value.
When paused by Peak Shaving: ramp down t: When paused by Peak Shaving: ramp down to 0 (safest) or follow Peak Shaving available budget.
If meter/budget values are older than th: If meter/budget values are older than this, Charging Management forces safe targets (STALE_METER).
Limits ramp-up per control cycle. Ramp-d: Limits ramp-up per control cycle. Ramp-down is always immediate for safety.
Limits ramp-up per control cycle in ampe: Limits ramp-up per control cycle in amperes. Ramp-down is always immediate for safety.
Quantize setpoints to this step size (ro: Quantize setpoints to this step size (rounded down). Set 0 to disable.
Quantize current setpoints to this step: Quantize current setpoints to this step size (rounded down). Set 0 to disable.
Connect this adapter to NexoWatt VIS. De: Connect this adapter to NexoWatt VIS. Default: nexowatt-vis.0. Tariff is read from <instance>.settings.*. RFID whitelist is used by Charging Management (MU8.2).
ioBroker instance name of the NexoWatt V: ioBroker instance name of the NexoWatt VIS adapter (e.g. nexowatt-vis.0). Used to read VIS settings under <instance>.settings.*.
Select the VIS state that contains the R: Select the VIS state that contains the RFID whitelist (e.g. JSON array, CSV, or newline-separated list).
Optional: current price from a provider. If set, it is used for the tariff grid-charge gate. If empty, you can still map it via the global datapoints table (tarif.preisAktuellEurProKwh).
Peak Shaving is disabled. Enable it in t: Peak Shaving is disabled. Enable it in the 'General' tab.
Charging Management is disabled. Enable: Charging Management is disabled. Enable it in the 'General' tab.
Storage control is disabled. Enable it i: Storage control is disabled. Enable it in the 'General' tab.
Multi-Use is disabled. Enable it in the: Multi-Use is disabled. Enable it in the 'General' tab.
This wizard helps you set up the adapter: This wizard helps you set up the adapter in the recommended order. You can switch to the expert tabs at any time.
Enable only the modules you actually nee: Enable only the modules you actually need.
For Peak Shaving you need at least the g: For Peak Shaving you need at least the grid meter power datapoint and a max power limit.
Step 3: Add actuators for Peak Shaving: Step 3: Add actuators for Peak Shaving
Add controllable loads/actuators that ma: Add controllable loads/actuators that may be reduced during Peak Shaving.
Define a total charging budget and then: Define a total charging budget and then add your wallboxes (manufacturer-independent mapping).
Define budgets (tariff / PV / comfort) a: Define budgets (tariff / PV / comfort) and add Multi-Use consumers.
Done. Save the configuration and restart: Done. Save the configuration and restart the adapter instance. If something does not work as expected, enable diagnostics in the General tab.
⚠ Peak Shaving: Please select 'Grid poin: ⚠ Peak Shaving: Please select 'Grid point power (W) - State ID'.
⚠ Actuators: Please add at least one act: ⚠ Actuators: Please add at least one actuator with unique ID and setpoint.
⚠ Wallboxes: Add at least one wallbox wi: ⚠ Wallboxes: Add at least one wallbox with unique Key, Actual power (W) and a setpoint (A or W).
⚠ Multi-Use: Add at least one consumer w: ⚠ Multi-Use: Add at least one consumer with unique Key and a setpoint DP key (A or W).
Peak Shaving: Please select the grid pow: Peak Shaving: Please select the grid power state (W).
Peak Shaving: In static mode please set: Peak Shaving: In static mode please set Max power (W) > 0.
Actuators: Add at least one actuator wit: Actuators: Add at least one actuator with unique ID and a setpoint State ID.
Charging: In static budget mode please s: Charging: In static budget mode please set Static max charging power (W) > 0.
Charging: In fromDatapoint budget mode p: Charging: In fromDatapoint budget mode please select Budget power (W) state.
Wallboxes: Add at least one wallbox with: Wallboxes: Add at least one wallbox with unique Key, Actual power (W) and a setpoint (A or W).
Multi-Use consumers: Add at least one co: Multi-Use consumers: Add at least one consumer with unique Key and a setpoint DP key (A or W).
